intro: Cremanthodium pilosum, commonly known as the hairy cremanthodium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
